author: Alex
title: The Internet is loving this hilariously honest Craigslist ad for a 2002 Oldsmobile
text:
Share on Facebook Share on Twitter + 
When it comes to buying shit from strangers online, honesty is in short supply. What you see ainâ€™t always what you get. I once responded to a Craigslist ad for a sofa from a fella named Bill. All I had to do was pay him $15 and help him unload it from his truck. Two weeks in a pit and several bottles of lotion later, I finally got that sofa back to my apartment â€” only to find it had a huge tear in the side. 
Iâ€™m far from alone here. Lots of people have been screwed over by sheisty Craiglist ads. Thatâ€™s why the internet is cracking up over this hilariously honest listing for a 2002 Oldsmobile Olero. Bruh when I tell y'all I am fucking dying right now pic.twitter.com/YWTGJTETtH 
â€” Snapchat: kel12121 (@kel12121) February 3, 2017 Hereâ€™s the full ad: Twitter is loving the honesty. The post has since been retweeted 65,000 times: @kel12121 @pai666e im in tears "damn right you gonna find something wrong with it"
